newsitem.title: UK: Comino Plc plans April flotation on AIM.
newsitem.headline: Comino Plc plans April flotation on AIM.

text.p: Software group Comino Plc said on Wednesday it is planning a flotation this month on the London Stock Exchange's Alternative Investment Market (AIM).
Proceeds from the float will be used to finance growth through further strategic acquisitions, the company said.
Williams de Broe, brokers to the issue, said the amount to be raised is likely to total between two and three million stg and the expected value of the company is seen around 14 million stg.
A date for the first day of dealings has not yet been set but the company hopes to seek a listing by the end of April.
Comino is the holding company of three specialist computer software companies.
Williams de Broe estimated Comino's annual turnover and pre-tax profits in 1996 were in excess of six million and one million stg respectively. The company has not yet published financial accounts.
